image.altText: Nighttime traffic on a snowy road with a truck in the foreground.

props.synopsis: New England North West residents have seen some of the biggest snowfalls in the region, with dozens of warnings in place across the state.

title.children: Parts of NSW see deepest snow in 20 years as SES responds to hundreds of calls

image.altText: guyra post office snow

props.synopsis: Visitors have flocked to high-altitude parts of the New England, like the town of Guyra, to catch a glimpse of the significant snowfall.Â

title.children: Visitors flock to NSW Northern Tablelands following heaviest snowfall in decades

image.altText: Hamas militants

props.synopsis: Hamas says it will not lay down arms until "the establishment of an independent, fully sovereign Palestinian state with Jerusalem as its capital".

title.children: Hamas says it won't disarm unless independent Palestinian state established

image.altText: Melting ice cream cone with US flag in the background and two sticks with Donald Trump's head with US flag sunglasses stuck in

props.synopsis: Returning to the US for the first time in four years, I found a country that didn't want to talk about politics, despite being in the eye of the Trump storm.

title.children: Trump's presidency is fast turning into one of the most consequential in decades

image.altText: A portait of Denise Bowden.

props.synopsis: Pressure is building on the federal government to remove funding from the Northern Territory government unless it meets outcomes on Indigenous incarceration.

title.children: 'No blank cheques': Pressure on federal government to pull territory funding

image.altText: Josh Lees and Amal Naser from Palestine Action Group raise their fists in victory after their court win

props.synopsis: A pro-Palestinian march across the Sydney Harbour Bridge on Sunday will proceed as an authorised event, after a judge declined to make a prohibition order over the rally, as sought by police.

title.children: 'Historic': Pro-Palestinian protesters to march over Harbour Bridge

image.altText: Tadhg Beirne and Tom Curry of the British and Irish Lions clash with Nic White

props.synopsis: Nic White makes his presence felt for the last time as a Wallaby, while Max Jorgensen stuns the Lions for the second time this series. Here are the five quick hits from the third Test at Stadium Australia.

title.children: Five quick hits: Lightning causes havoc, Nic is white hot, and Max stuns again

image.altText: Melbourne Vixens players celebrate winning the Super Netball grand final.

props.synopsis: After a lacklustre start to the 2025 season, the Melbourne Vixens upset minor premiers West Coast Fever in the Super Netball grand final, 59-58.

title.children: Fairytale finish for Vixens coach after mid-season resignation

image.altText: Logan Morris gestures to the crowd in celebration while teammates and opponents react behind him

props.synopsis: Brisbane underlines its premiership credentials with an impressive 27-point win over Collingwood at the MCG.

title.children: Lions make a statement with imperious MCG win over Magpies

image.altText: An NRL player gets carries the ball surrounded by other players.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Roosters beat Manly 20-4 in wet and wild conditions at Brookvale Oval, after the Dragons stun the table-topping Raiders.

title.children: Roosters score another try of the year contender in the wet against Manly

image.altText: Man looks at stock prices

props.synopsis: Weaker-than-expected US economic data and another round of US reciprocalÂ tariffs have roiled global financial markets.Â

title.children: 'Perfect storm' points to US recession and RBA interest rate cuts

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: The Trump administration quietly reversed a policy that tightened restrictions on microchip exports to China, but why the sudden backflip?Â

title.children: Did Trump just give China a major advantage on AI?

image.altText: A video still of Tom Gleeson behind a podium. The ABC lissajous in the top left corner and the Hard Quiz logo in the top right

props.synopsis: Back again, I see. Haven't you been humiliated enough?

title.children: You better believe I'm here to judge you. Let's playâ¦ HARD!

image.altText: A young girl sqauts in the dirt next to a fire of burning plastics that is heating a metal kettle.

props.synopsis: After fleeing Afghanistan, more than 1.8 million people have been forced to return to a country in the grip of economic collapse and draconian restrictions, especially for women.

title.children: They fled Afghanistan for a better life. Now they're being forced back

image.altText: Three silhouettes are seen against a large windscreen of a an aircraft flying over sprawling settlement.

props.synopsis: ABC journalists have marked the moment a plane bound for Gaza crossed the line from Israeli territory into northern Gaza.Â

title.children: The ABC can't enter Gaza â but we can describe it from a plane

image.altText: Oscar Piastri celebrates victory, standing on his car, helmet still on, raising his arms in the air

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri is chasing a seventh grand prix win in 2025, and a second consecutive Hungarian Grand Prix triumph. Here is what you need to know about the Hungarian Grand Prix.Â

title.children: F1 Hungarian Grand Prix: How to watch, what time does it start?

image.altText: A close up of a man's face as he stands in front of a bush

props.synopsis: Together, a new body horror starring Alison Brie and Dave Franco, ignited a bidding war at this year's Sundance Film Festival. Now the world is finally being let in to Australian director Michael Shanks's sticky nightmare.

title.children: Australian director went to US to get noticed, sells film for $26m

image.altText: A screenshot from the video game Rugby League 26 featuring a player from the NRLW competition.

props.synopsis: After a launch mired by bugs, server outages and criticism around player likenesses, Rugby League 26 video game developer Ross Symons defends his company and says unhappy players "should know better".

title.children: Developer of criticised NRL video game says unhappy players 'should know better'

image.altText: A woman scores a try in wet conditions during an NRLW match

props.synopsis: The NRLW's first-ever Magic Round is underway in Newcastle, but the opening day has been marred by torrential downpours that have delayed matches.Â

title.children: 'Couldn't see the ball': Wild weather hits inaugural NRLW Magic Round

image.altText: A man with walking sticks on a snowy mountain.

props.synopsis: Matthew Hutchinson says a school scholarship "fundamentally changed his life". He is now trekking across the US to give underprivileged kids the same opportunity.Â

title.children: 'Scruffy' kid who became surgeon thanks to scholarship treks to fund more

image.altText: A composite picture of a cheeseburger, Donald Trump, and the US and Australia flags

props.synopsis: As the world waits to hear news about US President Donald Trump's latest tariffs, the value of Australian cows has been soaring.

title.children: Aussie cow market takes off as tariffs loom and US burger prices rise

image.altText: An aerial view of a wharf part of the Darwin Port, with the city of Darwin in the distance.

props.synopsis: A worker is in hospital after an object fell and crushed his pelvis in a workplace accident at an East Arm site in Darwin.Â

title.children: Worker's pelvis crushed by falling object in industrial accident

image.altText: Two SES workers wearing orange uniforms, searching through a grassy landscape.

props.synopsis: The search for missing Alice Springs man Gach Top has been suspended after five days, after police and the SES sought local advice from trail guides and family friends.

title.children: Police suspend search for missing 26yo man Gach Top in Red Centre

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a suit stares off camera.

props.synopsis: The final seat of Bass has been decided, two weeks after the Tasmanian state election â with a veteran physician who is staunchly opposed to the proposed Hobart AFL stadium to take his place as an MP.

title.children: Independent opponent to Hobart stadium wins in final Tasmanian seat

image.altText: A family of three. The mum holds a black poodle and the son holds a football.

props.synopsis: After three successful organ transplants, the Stolkers say they've been given a new lease on life. Now they're campaigning for more Australians to become donors.

title.children: Organ transplants give family the 'gift of life' three times

image.altText: An Indigenous man shaking hands with the prime minister.

props.synopsis: NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro was not in attendance at the 25th Garma festival after pushing tough-on-crime rhetoric as the prime minister claims "the cheap politics of division" would not lead to solutions.

title.children: 'You are not listening': CLP criticisms aired at Garma Festival

image.altText: crime scene

props.synopsis: Police launch a murder investigation after the man was unable to be saved by emergency services in the inner Brisbane suburb of West End.

title.children: Murder probe launched after 50yo man dies in inner-Brisbane unit

image.altText: A woman wears a headscarf and carries her child while casting her vote

props.synopsis: Bangladesh has one of the world's largest overseas populations â yet almost none of them can vote from abroad.

title.children: Why some Australians will travel 9,000 kilometres to cast one vote

image.altText: a blurred photo of a man being put into handcuffs

props.synopsis: 26-year-old Michael Connors, who police allege entered the country on a fake passport, appeared in the Brisbane Arrest Court on Saturday and was charged with two migration offences.

title.children: Irish national allegedly used bedsheets to escape detention

image.altText: A young girl with blonde hair smiles for the camera.

props.synopsis: A new global study has identified a hereditary link associated with stuttering, and experts have said the research will be key to providing early intervention for people who struggle with the condition.

title.children: New research tipped to be 'life-changing' for people who stutter

image.altText: Profile of a tan-coloured handgun with a sight and flashlight affixed on a dark background

props.synopsis: Sig Sauer's P320 pistol has long been plagued by allegations of accidental firings without a trigger pull. The Australian Defence Force is rolling out a version of the handgun to personnel.

title.children: Defence stands by new handgun despite safety concerns

image.altText: Tesla Model S electric car

props.synopsis: Jurors awarded the estate of Naibel Benavides Leon and her former boyfriend, Dillon Angulo, $US129 million in compensatory damages, plus $US200 million in punitive damages.

title.children: Tesla ordered to pay $375 million in fatal autopilot crash

image.altText: A bone and statuette at a shrine in the Tuam graveyard in Ireland

props.synopsis: Two boys found "a jumble of bones", which sparked the discovery and now excavation of a mass grave at a mother-and-baby home run by Catholic nuns.

title.children: Mass graveyard of 800 children being excavated in Ireland

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell faces second week in court

props.synopsis: Ghislaine Maxwell has been transferred to a lower-security prison in Texas to continue serving her 20-year prison sentence for helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse underage girls.

title.children: Ghislaine Maxwell moved from Florida prison to lower-security facility

image.altText: Two 20-something women and a middle-aged man hold up a clapper board that says 'Optics'

props.synopsis: We don't want to brag but the ABC has received 44 Logie nominations this year. From deep-dive documentaries to side-splitting comedies, it would be selfish of us not to share these ABC gems for your viewing pleasure.

title.children: From big laughs to bold stories, the ABC's Logie-nominated shows are ready to binge
